intro: Clinostigma seemannii, commonly known as the African snowball, is a deciduous shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its dense, spherical clusters of white flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. The plant has small, leathery leaves that are arranged in a spiral pattern along the stems. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and requires full sun to partial shade. Clinostigma seemannii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
